On 1/25/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
> 5. If enough schools teach it, it becomes part of the standard curriculum.
> 6. If it becomes part of the standard curriculum, generations of
> practitioners treat it as "the way we do things".
>
> I think we're waiting for step 5. I suspect that by the time we reach
> step 6, there will be people at step 2 saying that TDD is "so 1999."

I have to ask--what will those people at step 2 be doing?  :-)

   David Saff
